alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 3:46AM PDT until October 25 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FIRST SNOW EVENT FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST TODAY... .Significant mountain snow accumulation above 3000 feet and measurable snow for lower elevations below 2500 feet. A robust and cold weather system will deliver mountain snow, lowland rain-snow, and colder overnight temperatures lingering through the remainder of the week. Mountain passes will be impacted by the heavy snowfall and lowland areas may see impacts to trees and sensitive vegetation from wet snow accumulation. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow especially elevations above 3500 feet. Additional snow accumulations 1 to 4 inches above 3500 feet and a half an inch to an inch below 3500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph...mainly on the Colville reservation. * WHERE...Sherman Pass, Highway 20 Wauconda Summit, Chesaw Road, Republic, Wauconda, Inchelium, and Boulder Creek Road. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult over mountain passes and high elevation roadways. Theses winter weather conditions will impact the morning commute on roadways and passes. Locations that see heavy wet snow could experience tree damage if they have not yet lost their leaves.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
